sources.data_found: Raj HPC cluster has a total of 7,808 compute cores and 48 GPUs including three nodes built for training and running programs related to artificial intelligence and machine learning. It is built with Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) servers using the AMD Rome line of EPYC processors as well as NVIDIA Tesla v100 GPUs.

Raj has: Three nodes consisting of two Intel Cascade Lake 18 core 2.6 GHz processors, eight NVIDIA Tesla V100 GPU accelerators, NVLink high speed GPU interconnect, 768 GB RAM and 7 TB SSD NVMe scratch space.
Raj has a total of 7,808 CPU cores and 48 GPUs, including three 8-GPU nodes designed for advanced artificial intelligence and machine learning applications.
EECE Computer Cluster features ten nodes, each equipped with an AMD EPYC 7402P process (24 Cores@2.8 GHz), 128GB DDR4 memory (16GBx8), 2TB PCIe NVMe SSD, NVIDIA A5000 24GB GDDR6 GPU, and 10GbE NIC.
The total enrollment at Marquette University in 2023, both undergraduate and graduate, is 11,373 students.

Computer Science department homepage confirms graduate and undergraduate programs, with mentions of MS in Computer and Information Science ranked #21 of the 2025 Best Online Computer Science Programs by US News & World Report, and PhD program in Computer Science.

student_data.notes: Computer Science enrollment numbers are estimated based on degrees awarded data and typical time-to-degree. Collegefactual.com reported 67 bachelor's degrees in computer & information sciences awarded in 2022. Assuming a 4-year program with steady state enrollment, estimated undergraduate CS count = 67 × 3 years remaining ≈ 200. For MS students, collegefactual reported 30 MS degrees in 2021-2022, and with typical 2-year programs, estimated MS enrollment = 30 × 3 semesters ÷ 2 ≈ 45. However, Marquette also has MS in Data Science and MS in Computer & Information Science programs; estimating combined MS enrollment at 90 students. PhD program typically takes 4-5 years, with approximately 1 PhD awarded in 2022 (per collegefactual), estimating 30 PhD students total based on department size and faculty count (54 full-time faculty per US News).

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: EECE Computer Cluster has 10 nodes, each with 1 NVIDIA A5000 24GB GPU

gpu_resources.notes:
CLUSTERS INCLUDED + CALCULATIONS

1) Raj HPC Cluster (Central): Total of 48 GPUs, all NVIDIA Tesla V100. Specifically includes 3 AI/ML nodes with 8 V100 GPUs each (3 × 8 = 24 V100), plus additional GPU compute nodes accounting for remaining 24 V100 GPUs.

2) EECE Computer Cluster (Electrical & Computer Engineering Department): 10 nodes × 1 NVIDIA RTX A5000 GPU per node = 10 RTX A5000 GPUs (24GB each).

TOTAL GPU COUNT:
- V100 = 48 (all from Raj cluster)
- RTX A5000 = 10 (from EECE cluster, listed under other_high_vram_gpus as schema has no dedicated field for A5000)

analysis_notes: Data collected from multiple sources. GPU data from Marquette's HPC and departmental computing resources. Student enrollment from official spring 2025 statistics (total enrollment) with CS-specific estimates based on degrees awarded and typical program durations.
